column4: Hi, I'm new to ubuntu, I just tried installing ies4linux (for webdesign purposes), but the install terminal just dissapeears when extracting the cab files, although cabextracter is installed, anyone experience with this?
Bring up a terminal, and type it in yourself.
That way, it has a chance to _ask_ you critical questions, and give you output.
(For example, it asks you which versions of ie you want to install)
you would suggest me a complete manual install of IE? (and if so, do you know a guide or something to help me)
Personally, I run Win98 and WinXP within Qemu + Kqemu
It's a very heavy-handed approach, though.  I can verify that ie4linux works flawlessly on Ubuntu Dapper.
At least, ie 6 installs without any issue whatsoever.
I used the default version of cabextractor that ubuntu has.
I installed cabextractor through package manager (I even think it was installed indeed), now I just tried through terminal and it said couldn't find package
Show me the error please. (Use the pastebin!)
